meanings.definition: In a misleading or deceptive manner.
meanings.sent1: She spoke fallaciously, trying to trick him into believing her story.
meanings.sent2: He was accused of acting fallaciously by providing false information.
meanings.sent3: The magician performed fallaciously, making the audience believe in his fake magic tricks.
meanings.sent4: The politician's promises rang fallaciously in the ears of the voters.
meanings.sent5: The con artist operated fallaciously, swindling innocent people out of their money.

meanings.definition: Based on a mistaken belief or unsound reasoning.
meanings.sent1: The fallaciously constructed argument failed to convince anyone.
meanings.sent2: She made a fallaciously assumption about his intentions.
meanings.sent3: The cat's fallaciously attempt to catch the laser pointer entertained the whole family.
meanings.sent4: His fallaciously logic led him to make poor decisions.
meanings.sent5: The old superstition was fallaciously believed by many in the village.
